page.title: 18COLDHARBOUR VILLAGE
page.content:
The school closed in l968 and the children are taken by coach to Ockley and Dorking. Transport for the villagers is provided twice daily by the post bus. Police visit from Dorking.
The population of roughly l60 are mainly commuters but forestry provides work for some. "The Plough Inn" is a popular haunt for the hikers and bikers. The cricket club still flourishes and the 'Not So Young' Club provides outings for the elderly. The Women's Institute meet in their own houses until the new Church Room is completed.
